panelText.text: Bribery can happen anywhere, and it doesn’t always look like cash changing hands.
Bribery occurs when someone is given anything of value in an attempt to improperly influence their decisions or actions. Anything of value could include:

• Stock in a company
  • Lavish gifts or gratuities
  • Excessive entertainment or hospitality
  • Sightseeing or vacations, even when connected with a legitimate business trip
  • Unwarranted rebates or excessive commissions
  • Unusual or disguised allowances, expenses, or political or charitable contributions
  • Jobs for customers, their family members or friends

Giving or receiving a bribe is strictly prohibited at Johnson Controls and is illegal in almost all locations where we do business. Fines for bribery are significant and authorities pursue the employees involved in the activity, as well as the company.
